intro: Urocarpus pallidus, commonly known as the pale sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species adapted to dry environments. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with small, fleshy leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are typically greenish-yellow and clustered in dense inflorescences, which are often covered in fine hairs. Urocarpus pallidus is well adapted to sandy soils and can thrive in areas with minimal rainfall.
